page.title: 03Shustoke,near Coleshill.
page.content: As we drove from Coleshill town due east into the valley of the river Blyhe we passed a few large houses and then the scenery changed dramatically .We drove passed arable land and pasture land by the river and some deciduous woodland.We passed over the dismantled track of the "Stonebridge Railway".Our first impressions of Shustoke was a quiet country village but as we progressed into the village we saw the busy main road went straight through.The village green is still there with a modern bus shelter for the daily bus service to Coleshill .By the green is the Plough Inn and the post office and stores.The other facilities are a sports ground,church hall and a primary school. The houses include council,large ,semi-detatched and some very old.It is a lovely old village in the countryside.
